Event: Congratulations! You are hired as the project manager. In this row you will learn the relevant part of the story of the particular space.
Action: This row will summarise the actions that may need to be done to progress the game.
Outcome: And this row is items chosen by chance… but not always because you can reject lady luck and NEGOTIATE.
w_card: The scope of work is W cards. Here you learn how to add remove or change scope. Just remember 20% design fee is the max.
b_card: You can not build if you do not have $ - Bank will lend you a little $ rather quickly and at a low rate.
i_card: You can not build if you do not have $ - Investor will lend you a lot of $ rather slowly and at a higher rate.
l_card: In real life shit happens all the time. In this game it only happens here.
e_card: Once in a while you may want specialized help. It is available in this row. But will it help you or hinder you.
Time: Time is $ and time is always ticking here. So keep your eye out on this space.
Fee: Of course to get things unstuck or get things done at all - you have to pay people up front. Watch this trickle so it does not become a flood.
space_1: Lastly you may have choices of where to go next.
space_2: These are alternative paths available to you.
space_3: Some spaces offer 3-5 different next destinations.
space_4: Choose wisely as each path affects your strategy.
space_5: Some spaces require special conditions to unlock paths.
Negotiate: and if you really realy realy do not like your choices …. Sometimes you can refuse them and just try again.

Event: Now that you read the first column and know the rules - here is your strategy guide:
Action: You just got hired by an owner. The 2 of you will dream up / design / review and build a project.
Outcome: Strategise and pick the right dice rolls
w_card: while being aware of the 20% design fee limit.
b_card: Watch out how much you borrow
i_card: and from whom. Bank offers quick small loans at low rates.
l_card: Beware that in the meantime life happens
e_card: so don't forget to use your Expeditor help. Investor offers large loans at higher rates but takes longer.
Time: and try to do it as quickly as possible.
Fee: Pay attention to fees - they accumulate quickly
space_1: and choose the most advantageous path to win.
space_2: Each space offers different movement options.
space_3: Plan your route based on your current resources.
space_4: Some paths are faster but riskier.
space_5: Others are safer but take more time.
Negotiate: Don't forget waiting 1 extra turn if the roll is really bad may be more advantageous.

Event: The owner dreams up an idea of project scope.
Action: You as PM can review their scope and either accept it or negotiate by repeating the roll next turn.

Event: You changed the owner's mind.
Action: This roll will determine your path.

Event: Owner does some number crunching and comes up with their share of money.
Action: You look at the scope estimates and the money owner gave you. You can take it or waste time and hope to renegotiate next turn.
w_card: Draw 1 if scope ≤ $ 4 M (fees do not matter this turn as it is owner's money)
b_card: Draw 1 if scope > $ 4 M (fees do not matter this turn as it is owner's money)

Event: Owner is quite upset and comes up with a new number.
Action: You look at the scope estimates and the money owner gave you and laugh… but leave the room.
b_card: Draw 1 if scope ≤ $ 4 M (fees do not matter this turn as it is owner's money)
i_card: Draw 1 if scope > $ 4 M (fees do not matter this turn as it is owner's money)

Event: As project manager your first decision is to determine the direction of project.
Action: You and expeditor strategize and come up with some changes. Life happens and you choose a path forward.

Event: You are a thinker and need to reasses the situation. What will you do next?
Action: Your staff sees an oportunity at the competition and leaves you. Meanwhile life passes you by and you finally decide what to do next.
e_card: The person to your right takes a card.

Event: You need more money! - The lender reviews the business plan and negotiates scope for a better rate.
Action: Scope negotiations last a while as life pases you by. Your expeditor comes up with an idea and the deal is struck!

Event: Burning through the pile of cash is easier than you thought… Time to get som fresh dough.
Action: More money = more staff scope and life changes.

Event: You wait patiently as the bank underwrites to determine the loan amount and rate.
Action: Having money will alow you to hire and and spend maybe even have a life.
Fee: 1% for loan of up to $1.4M or 2% for loan between $1.5M and 2.75M or 3% above 2.75M

Event: You wait impatiently as the bank underwrites to determine the loan amount and rate.
Action: It is late in the game - you are starting to loose credibility. Staff is leaving. Life is passing you by.
Fee: 1% for loan of up to $1.4M or 2% for loan between $1.5M and 2.75M or 3% above 2.75M

Event: You wait patiently as the investors determine the loan amount and rate.
Action: Having money will alow you to hire and and spend maybe even have a life.

Event: You wait impatiently as the investors determine the loan amount and rate.
Action: It is late in the game - you are starting to loose credibility. Staff is leaving. Life is passing you by.
e_card: The person to your left takes a card.

Event: You are searching for the architect.
Action: You are making phone calls and looking at qualifications… in the mean time others play…as you roll for outside influence only.

Event: Architect glances over files to determine if change to drawings is needed.
Action: As time ticks you think: Looks bad you may have to redesign again!

Event: Architect negotiates their initial fees.
Action: Everyone wants money from you! You paid a big chunk so now you have to save a little by cutting your staff.

Event: Architect negotiates additional architect fees.
Action: You cross your fingers and wait for life to dump on you. You will need a friend in need.

Event: Architect 's team finished their design. Today you are attending the final presentation.
Action: The architect takes their time to get to the initial design scope determination.

Event: Architect subsequent design review determination.
Action: Roll for outcome.
e_card: The person to your right takes a card.

Event: You are searching for the engineer.
Action: More phone calls and qualification reviews… in the mean time others play…as you roll for outside influence card.

Event: Engineer glances over files to determine if change to drawings is needed.
Action: You try to read the engineers lips before he tells you your path.

Event: Engineer negotiates their initial fees.
Action: Every penny counts - you get your best man involved.

Event: Engineer negotiates additional architect fees.
Action: How do we make this sound like it is included in the original fee?

Event: Engineer's team finished their design. Time for another final presentation.
Action: I am not building a rocket ship. Why is this taking so long? What will the design be?

Event: Engineer subsequent design review determination.
Action: The roll of drawings you got does not look any different. You wonder if there are changes.

Event: Some decisions require owners input. Especially when owner wants it THEIR WAY.
Action: The owners ponder and tell you their plans.

Event: It has been a while since last review. Time is running out and owner just wants to see the finish line.
Action: Impatintly the owners hear you out and come to a quick decision.

Event: Let's get this shit done at any cost! they said… So you are looking to cut a few days off the top.
Action: You are nervous - the odds are not in your favor.

Event: Cheating last time did not go so well. You still want to try but are a lot more carefull.
Action: Review path and fees are determined by 1 dice roll.

Event: Owner pays DOB fees.
Action: Fork over the cash…And hire a few staff.

Event: Determine if additional fees are due to Department of Buildings.
Action: hope not to fork over more cash…And replace staff.

Event: Project manager chooses (slow and low risk) or (fast and high risk) path at DOB.
Action: You have a choice to say Plan Exam (slow) or Prof Cert (fast).

Event: Waiting tor Clerks to process files or for appointment.
Action: Hurry Up and Wait…

Event: Plan examiner takes time to do first review.
Action: You try to sound like you knw the code and wait for their determination.

Event: Plan examiner rushes through the review.
Action: You stay qiuet and only speak when spoken to - which stamp will he use approval or denial?

Event: DOB Clerk almost notices your existance while processing your papaerwork.
Action: You chew your gum intently hoping no errors are done in data entry.

Event: DOB Clerk greets you by saying -You again?- and processes your paper work
Action: You hope that this time the expeditor filled out the forms correctly… after all you paid almost a grand.

Event: Nerdy auditor cites from memory ZR-23.5 while auditing your application.
Action: You got home after a long day at Department of Buildings and you find that your job was audited - where did we go wrong?

Event: Auditor notices the number of objections fixed and continues with audit.
Action: We almost had it and now it is down to the last few objections. Will they pass?

Event: FDNY Clerk checks to see if job review needs to be done.
Action: You have to answer a maze of questions to get out of gere.
space_1: Did you pass FDNY approval before? YES - Space 2 - NO - Space 3
space_2: Did the scope change since the last visit? YES - REG-FDNY-PLAN-EXAM - NO - Space 3
space_3: Did Department of Buildings send you here? YES - REG-FDNY-PLAN-EXAM - NO - Space 4
space_4: Do you have: sprinklers / standpipe / fire alarm / fire suppression? YES - REG-FDNY-PLAN-EXAM - NO - Space 5
space_5: Do you have  DOB approval? YES - PM-DECISION-CHECK or CON-INITIATION NO - REG-DOB-TYPE-SELECT

Event: FDNY Clerk checks to see if job review needs to be done.
Action: Assess 4 criteria.
space_1: Did you pass FDNY approval before? YES - Space 2 - NO - Space 3
space_2: Did the scope change since the last visit? YES - REG-FDNY-PLAN-EXAM - NO - Space 3
space_3: Did Department of Buildings send you here? YES - REG-FDNY-PLAN-EXAM - NO - Space 4
space_4: Do you have: sprinklers / standpipe / fire alarm / fire suppression? YES - REG-FDNY-PLAN-EXAM - NO - Space 5
space_5: Do you have  DOB approval? YES - PM-DECISION-CHECK or CON-INITIATION NO - REG-DOB-TYPE-SELECT

Event: Plan examiner takes time to do first review.
Action: You try to sound like you know the code and wait for their determination.

Event: Plan examiner rushes through the review.
Action: You stay qiuet and only speak when spoken to - which stamp will he use approval or denial?

Event: The contractor has to be chosen to finaly make your dreams come true.
Action: You roll 2 times (1st quality of Contractor) (2nd multiplier) and than you do a lot of math.

Event: Project Manager negotiates a change order.
Action: Now we negotiate time extension.

Event: Construction many time unearths unforseen issues in the field.
Action: You attempt to resolve everything on the spot because delays are expensive.

Event: Problems never stop at a construction site - but every day counts.
Action: Once again you try to prevent issues. No time for delays.
e_card: The person to your right takes a card.

Event: That inspector looks fresh this is eiter good or bad news.
Action: You notice a safety violation and distract the inspector making him look the other way - will it work?

Event: Inspector Johnes never liked you; but at least he tries to be fair.
Action: Luckily the Frank's team just finished in time for this inspection. You think it should be smooth saling.

Event: The clerks are having a bitrtday party. Everything is delayed an hour
Action: At least the clerks will be happy - you think when you hand in the final files.

Event: the supervisor is consoling one of the clerks - everything is slow again.
Action: Worst part is everyone seems in bad mood. Will they notice the photocopy instead of original?

Event: You Completed project!
Action: YOU ARE done! Calculate final score.

Event: You Completed project!
Action: YOU ARE done! Calculate final score.
